intro: Humboltia lindenii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Humboltia lindenii is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots and a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
